label: 鎮護国家
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: the concept of realm protection," deriving from certain Buddhist scriptures (e.g., Saishōōkyō 最勝王経, Konkōmyōkyō 金光明経, and Ninnōkyō 仁王経), to the effect that the Buddha protects and blesses any realm where the Buddhist cult is faithfully patronized by the ruler. The climactic expression of this concept was establishment of the provincial temple system in Shōmu's era.　[聖武]"
